content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that solves your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    wrapped_str = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_str) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
        end
        
        wrapped_str *= "$word "
    end
    
    return wrapped_str
end
```

This function splits the input string `s` into words and checks if adding a new word would exceed the maximum width. If it does, it adds a newline character to start a new line. It then appends each word followed by a space to the result string `wrapped_str`.

For example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("Hello world"))
```
Outputs:
```
Hello 
world
```
